issue.title: [R] Validate winlibs binaries with hash
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-5015](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5015). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
See <https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4011#discussion_r269229280>

It is a common practice to download binaries from the winlibs R repo; however, for the arrow project, validating the package against a SHA256/SHA512 hash is desired.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5015?focusedCommentId=17083641) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
This might be nice, but in practice no one downloads from rwinlib: CRAN does it once to build the binary R package, and then all Windows users download that.
